claims.claim: Returning citizens struggle with adapting to modern technology after incarceration.
claims.quote: They come home and they're expected to, to get just engulfed in, in what's happening in the world right now. And they don't have any, any information on, on what, what a lot of this is.

claims.claim: Incarceration from a young age leaves individuals unprepared for technological advancements in society.
claims.quote: A lot of these individuals had left here, left home when they were like as young as 13 years old. And coming home when they're like 50, 60 years old.

claims.claim: Modern vehicles' technology can be challenging for returning citizens to adapt to.
claims.quote: I have a car that. You don't even put a key into it. You just push a button in. It starts up and you don't even have a gear shift. You push a button and it shifts gears for you.

claims.claim: The transition from traditional to smart TVs is difficult for those incarcerated for long periods.
claims.quote: So your television is a smart tv. So you have to learn how to operate all these new things.
